There will be two blocks, two days apart.

The
 individual lectures in the first block (lecturer’s input) will begin at
 02:00 p.m. CEST (08:00 a.m. EST in the US, 08:00 p.m. in the Far East) 
and will take ca. 1.5 - 2 hours. We shall begin on the dot, i.e., 
exactly at the appointed time, s.t.

Monday,
 July 8:                 Introductory Lecture, assignment of topics to 
individual students for 15 – 30 minute talks in the second block

Wednesday,
 July 10:       Spectacular Failures (cont’d), Literature, Introduction 
to VDI Guideline 3822, Do’s and Don’ts in Failure Analysis
Thursday, July 11:             Introduction to Fractography, Characterization Methods
Friday, July 12:                   Characterization Methods (cont’d), Electron Backscatter Diffraction for Failure Analysis
Monday, July 15:               Additive Manufacturing and Failure Analysis, Hydrogen Embrittlement, Wrap-up of first block
Note that the attached outline is just a collection of topics and will not be followed by the letter.

The
 second block with students’ presentations will start each day at 09:00 
a.m. CEST, c.t., i.e., it will actually start at 09:15 a.m., each day, 
for 2 days and will end no later than 04:00 p.m. CEST.
Thursday, July 18, 09:15 a.m. – 04:00 p.m. CEST:          students’ presentations
Friday, July 19, 09:15 a.m. – 11:45 a.m. CEST:               students’ presentations

Friday,
 July 19, 02:00 p.m. – 04:00 p.m. CEST                excursion to 
Siemens Energy’s Gas Turbine Manufacturing Plant at Huttenstrasse 12, D –
 10553 Berlin, Germany (voluntary, not required for credit points).

The
 first block shall mostly be input from me, hopefully with plenty of 
discussion and Q&A. In the second block, students are encouraged to 
give their own talks on specific subjects. Whoever aims for getting 
grades and credit points for this lecture will have to present a talk on
 a subject of his or her choosing. Attached is a general outline of the 
contents we loosely followed last year to cover the most important 
topics of FA.
The link to access the Teams meeting will be sent out separately shortly.

An
 excursion is planned to Siemens Energy's Berlin Gas Turbine Plant at 
Huttenstrasse 12 in Berlin-Moabit, Zip code D-10553. This will take 
place in the afternoon of the last day of the lecture, beginning at 
02:00 p.m., ending at ca. 04:00 p.m. Attendance is not mandatory.
